website_summaries.verdict: The SanDisk Sansa Clip+ is an excellent successor to the line, offering a fitness-friendly design with a built-in belt-clip, a simple interface, solid sound quality, and plenty of handy features--all for an ultralow price. It's an unbeatable value.
pros: The SanDisk Sansa Clip+ is very inexpensive
it has a solid, pocket-friendly design with dedicated volume controls and a built-in belt-clip
and it offers a plethora of handy features, including a MicroSD card slot, Rhapsody DNA, a voice recorder, an FM tuner, and support for FLAC, Ogg, Audible, and podcasts
cons: The SanDisk Sansa Clip+ could stand to have better battery life and support for AAC
the monochrome display is small and may be hard for some to read

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while then problems developed
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for about 4 years then the 4 way selector (up, down, left & right) button stopped working. Also the power button is very hard to press to turn it off & on. Good sound but the newer ones are much better since the power button is now on the face instead of the side or top.
customer_reviews.author: Phil D

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: This SanDisk MP3 player lasts forever. I owned a previous one and decided to get this as a second one. Music sounds great, easy to upload, battery life could be a little longer but this thing is great.
customer_reviews.author: D.F.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect - does exactly what I need!
customer_reviews.text: I don't need fancy bells and whistles - just something that plays my music and books. This is it. It holds a good bit of music, and - if that's not enough for you - slip in a mini SD and it holds more! Sound is good, transferring to and from computer is easy, charge lasts a good few hours. Maneuvering the menu and finding things on the player can be a bit tricky sometimes, but not too bad. Don't worry if you get caught in the rain on a run... just tuck it away using the very convenient clip. I've only had one break because of water, and then I just bought a new one! They're inexpensive!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Kopek

customer_reviews.title: this is just the best MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: For me, this is just the best MP3 player! I love how it is able to use a microSD memory stick for easy replacement of the content I listen to. I have one stick with audio books on it, one with classical music, one with rock music and one with transcribed TED talks. It's great for commutes and the output matches my car stereo AUX input just fine. It also works great on long airline flights and on the beach. I have bought several of these. I like to give them for gifts at Christmas. I load them with program material suited to the recipient. One year I gave three with the content of our pastor's sermons on board.
customer_reviews.author: David Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Earphone jack always fails
customer_reviews.text: My third unit like this quickly failed in the same fashion as the last two. I've had it about 6 months, the worst yet. The earphone jack slowly stops making good contact until is finally stops working at all. I'm now trying to decide how to open it an fix it myself. The sad thing is, I may buy another one eventually as it's still the cheapest option for Audible books even if you have to buy a new one every year. Twice a year is starting to get a bit silly.
customer_reviews.author: device9

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I am dreadfully disappointed in this player. I purchased it because of the FM receiver. My previous Sansa Fuze had been worn out and is no longer manufactured. This appeared to be the logical replacement. The receiver is okay if you are minimally mobile but just a constant stream of static if you run or move at any pace faster than a crawl. I have found a refurbished scansa fuze and am replacing this item sansa clip. I will probably look for more of the old fuze to hold as back up when this refurb is worn out. If you want an FM receiver, bypass this "clip" and go for a refurbished Sansa Fuze. You will not go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Auburn

customer_reviews.title: Small and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Small and easy to use, great when working out! I used to have one of these and used it every single time I worked out for over five years and NEVER had a problem with it. I just recently purchased a new black one here on Amazon and LOVE LOVE LOVE it. I used to have an Ipod but it broke after a few months of working out (maybe sweat?). I also love that you can plug this MP3 player to a computer and quickly add or remove songs. I highly recommend this product and will only use this device for running or working out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good interface, broke too early
customer_reviews.text: It was a refurb, fine, but the power button broke off where it connects to the board, rendering the unit worthless. I had to pry the case open to figure out what was wrong, and unfortunately it was something I couldn't fix. The connection is pretty small for such a critical and oft-used feature, which is a poor design. Further, the unit will more or less at random decide not to play certain songs, but then decide to play them once they're re-loaded. This happened on both Clips I've had. When this one broke I spent the money on a Shuffle, which is working alright so far.
customer_reviews.author: Alex V.

customer_reviews.title: Fine music player - meets expectations
customer_reviews.text: I do not use the Sansa software much, as I tried it a few times and had issues, particularly with digitial security. It probably is not really a flaw with the software, but rather with a flawed method to 'protect' files. I cannot be bothered with trying to copy these protected files because it fails so many times, even using Media Player. Anyway, the player has all the basic features. The one I like the most is probably resume playback. The volume is a good range, the screen text is not too small, the buttons are of good quality. No significant complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Coastal Flyer

customer_reviews.title: records FM radio
customer_reviews.text: I like the side volume button (one button with up/down) although it doesn't seem very durable. I wanted FM recording and this does have it even though I didn't see it in the description. The CD manual is a small CD and it doesn't play in my regular CD player, so I downloaded the online manual. Very small and lightweight. Songs seem hard to arrange, but you can create playlists on your computer and then download the list into the playlist section. Headphone jack is on the right upper side. The power button is on the right top. This is more user friendly than my Ematic. I will update this if necessary, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: C2000

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Cool
customer_reviews.text: This is terrifically practical; about the size of a thumb drive, less than 30 bucks, holds enough for a couple days of listening, turn it on and forget it. Our Sansa Clip 2G holds 458 of our favorite tunes. The output is plugged into the auxiliary input of our stereo receiver. The sound quality is equivalent to CDs at high volume levels. We set it to shuffle and listen to music all weekend without exhausting the music library. The first one died after three days. Amazon handled the replacement by the end of the week and we were back in business with nothing out of pocket. If this one lasts a year, it will be a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Crash

customer_reviews.title: Very good & affordable mp3 player
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 4GB version of this product about 2 years ago and have used it to play a loop of audio tracks for my company's phone system. For the time I owned the product, it was running 24 hours per day, 7 days per week. It basically lasted about 17,520 hours. That's not bad. Unfortunately, the 4GB version froze up and stopped working so I had to purchase another one. I really did not need the extra space and figured the 2GB one would suffice. It is easy to load music onto the player and so far it works great. I hope this one will last just as long.
customer_reviews.author: NJ2F

customer_reviews.title: Extremely handy mp3 player for book and music
customer_reviews.text: The Clip is very light and handy. I like to clip it to a belt loop and clip my ear bud headphones to my shirt front. The screen shows enough info to identify the music or book I am reading and my progress in that selection. I have to be careful when recharging, however, because the player "refreshes" the media when it finishes and I can lose my place in the book I am reading. With a slot for a 16-GB micro SD card, the 2-GB model of the Clip seems sufficient for my needs. Trying to synch to my pc using Microsoft Media Player is too complicated, however. Copy and Paste works fine.
customer_reviews.author: P. Carson

customer_reviews.title: Intuitive, holds "just enough" music
customer_reviews.text: The included clip is a godsend. My 8-year-old gets bored easily and having her own music is a savior on trips. It holds just enough for our typical day-trips, filling the gaps in activity and keeping her occupied. It's sturdy and has already survived several drops. The controls are simple and intuitive, and lasts for days on a single charge. Sync integration with Windows Media Player means I don't have to install any other software (we have Windows 7 Ultimate). The best part is the ability to play any MP3 files - I don't have to have any specific account and can add the songs I want, not what the manufacturer ALLOWS me to have.
customer_reviews.author: shokkdog

customer_reviews.title: good inexpensive MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for an inexpensive MP3 player with a great FM tuner this is the one for you. My only complaint is the instruction manual that comes with the player and even the online user manual are not very well written. Unless you are already familiar with the basics of how these players work, they can be a little difficult to understand. I found that I could "google" questions about how to do things on this unit and get better answers than using the instruction manual. That being said, once I became familiar with how the unit works it is fairly easy to use and has a lot of good features.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What an amazing MP3
customer_reviews.text: I can't help to say this but, this little guy is fantastic. I have not had an issue with this Mp3 player since I have bought, I believe it's been 2 years. All I know that it supports up to 32 GB Micro SD card. I have a 8 GB Micro SD added with the internal 2 gb, which is 10GB in total and all I need. And the voice recorder in this little guy works okay, could be better but it helped me record some notes for college, since it's VERY discreet and Colleges are so butt hurt about using voice recorders. Anyway, the radio is also good, it's only FM though.
customer_reviews.author: IamSirrius

customer_reviews.title: My third Sansa Clip
customer_reviews.text: My first Sansa Clip (1GB) was a gift and seems to have expired. My second, purchased after I received the first was to replace it, but I found out that the first just needed to be correctly set. I purchased the Sansa Clip 2GB to replace the first which this time I haven't been able to revive. I use only the FM radio, and the new one seems to wander a little on the tuning scale. Moving the tuner up or down a click clears it up for a while but is not a permanent fix.
customer_reviews.author: Paul's wife

customer_reviews.title: SO MUCH BETTER THAN IPOD SHUFFLE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nine year old daughter because she wanted an ipod shuffle like mine. I worried that she wouldn't take good care of an ipod so I opted for the Sansa Clip because it was less expensive. Now I wish I had the Sansa too. The features it offers are superior to my shuffle and the sound quality is amazing. It is so easy to use and my daughter just loves it! I'm back to buy another one for my 7 year old. I also bought Silicone cases to protect them and give them more color. This is a great value and a great product and as always, Amazon had the best price!
customer_reviews.author: CougarCountry

customer_reviews.title: All I can say is EXCELLENT!
customer_reviews.text: I lost two of my SanDisk 4 GB players and without them I was lost. I ordered this new 2 GB SanDisk and even at that I was not disappointed. So easy to use and download my audible.com books as well as music I keep on Amazon which allows me to send the files to Windows Media player to load them onto the SanDisk. You can also load podcasts. Has sleep timer and FM radio and you can set presets. You can easily add and delete items on SanDisk. The sound is powerful!
customer_reviews.author: J F Whitmore

customer_reviews.title: Bummer!
customer_reviews.text: Had to chunk it!!! This is the second one that's gone to crap in less than a year. The first one's power button came loose within a couple weeks. The replacement was fine for several months, but suddenly won't hold a charge for more than 15 minutes... weird. Used this primarily for Rhapsody downloads, and it worked like a charm (when it held a charge). Downside... battery life on a full charge is pretty lousy... initially, maybe a couple hours if you're lucky. Plus, FM reception is pretty bad compared to other budget MP3's I've owned. Served its purpose, but inexcusable flaws. Am now using my Android for Rhapsody... all is well.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Galvan

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete
customer_reviews.text: I got the product quickly, however, it was not complete. The software (CD) that is suppose to come with it to set up the unit with your PC was not there. The sound quality is not very good, I have to reposition the unit frequently to minimize static sounds. I didn't think that I had purchased a refurbished item, but that seems to be what I got. I have had one of these units before and was very happy with it, that's why I bought another one. I think I will shop around for something else.
customer_reviews.author: colorado cat

customer_reviews.title: Get this thing, even if you have an iPod
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for just an mp3 player with decent amount of functionality, look no further than the Sansa Clip+ Rated as an editors' choice at Cnet definitely solidifies its legitability Pros: extremely portable very good FM reception with nice quality fm recording displays in many languages syncs with rhapsody lots of custom settings definitely a "big bang for the buck" Cons: takes long time to refresh media after inserted an micro SD card (had to refresh every time I took it out) other than that this thing is almost flawless, extremely recommanded
customer_reviews.author: J Fizzle

customer_reviews.title: Great Player for the Gym.
customer_reviews.text: The clip is great for working out...It clips on easily to your workout clothes. Works Seamlessly with Windows 7 / Media Player. You do not need to instal anyhting! So do not load the little CD that comes with it, you don't need it. It is also easily recognized as an external memory device so you do not even need to use MS Media Player. Finally an MP3 player that doesn't strong arm you into loading its own software so it can foirce you to down load from its partners sites and keep tabs on you. Keep in mind it is rechargeable only. Their is no battery change out if you need that.
customer_reviews.author: LeoMtl

customer_reviews.title: Best Little MP3 Player on the Market!!
customer_reviews.text: This SanDisk Sanda MP3 Player is the third one I've bought in the past 3 years. One I lost, and the other I use only for soft beach music. This model carries more than 35 albums, which is more than enough for the gym, where I used it as a stimulant for my workouts. It easily clips on your gym short, or gym shirt and it has a FM radio tuner too. It chargers quite fast on my computer and a single charge lasts about ten, one-hour gym workouts. And at around $50, I think it's a much better value than an Ipod. Highly recommended. [...]
customer_reviews.author: Joe Bruno Sr.

customer_reviews.title: 3 1/8 INCH INSTALLATION CD
customer_reviews.text: Just received this and so far like it very much. The music sound quality is excellent. Antenna is not as good as my Sansa C150, but that's not a showstopper for me. It's amazing to me that I'm buying this only 4 years after the C150 and, w/ the exception of antenna quality, it's such a superior product at less than half the price. Only serious (?) problem so far is that the IMac doesn't support CDs smaller than a 4.7" standard CD. The installation disk is 3 1/8 inch, can't be used on my IMAC. So far, the Clip seems to work very well without "installation"--am I missing something?
customer_reviews.author: Masonville

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk Sansa Clip+ 2 GB - GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Great little mp3 player. Pros: Software set up easily. Left it plugged in long enough for a full charge, loaded my tunes and went jogging. Ear buds sound great for the price, purposely left it on and playing after jogging just to check out battery life for 3 hours. Still had a charge when I stopped the music. Cons: I haven't yet figured out how to get it to play songs in the order I loaded them instead of alphabetically by artist - Apparently the default play order. Hopefully I can figure that out. Summation: Killer deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: S. Michael Claggett

customer_reviews.title: Had one before, when it finally died I bought another.
customer_reviews.text: So I guess it's not great that the first one died, but it was a dirt cheap "refurbished" model. I had ran it into the ground listening to it so much in my car and on my motorcycle. It got to a point where plugged in it worked perfect, but could not hold a charge for even a second. I used some crappy player from work for a few months, plus my iPhone, before I gave in and bought another Sansa. The controls are a lot easier to navigate through a gloved hand then most devices, it's cheap, and it sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: So much better than an iPod!
customer_reviews.text: I had an iPod for years and got so sick of iTunes crashing and filling up my PC's (which are regularly updated). My husband got a Sansa Clip a couple of years ago and loved it, plus it was so easy to fill and maintain. So I finally took the plunge when the time came to replace my old iPod and I could not be happier. I am afraid I think you pay for the Apple name and for no obvious benefit anymore, when there are so many alternatives. I got way more memory for my money and great sound quality and ease of use. Sansa is the way to go as far as I am concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah W

customer_reviews.title: Clip+  -  Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: The Sansa Clip+ is fifth mp3/media player I've owned. It is by far the best. I listen primarily to podcasts. It has both a fast-forward and extra-fast forward. Great for speeding through sections of an hour long mp3. It holds your place where you stop; even if you switch to another mp3, listen to FM, or even if you load new material it allows you to resume listening where you left off. Like other Sansa players, it has an equalizer. Preferred over the usual gimmicky tone presets. The firmware was clearly written by users of the product. Menus are thorough and easy to learn. Clip +; Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce C. Eaton

customer_reviews.title: A First Grade Device
customer_reviews.text: I purchased seven of these devices for use in my first grade class this year with stories in mp3 format. The kids loved them. One unit would not charge after a couple of months and the manufacture replaced it free of charge. I didn't actually teach the children how to use them but most of them figured it out fairly quickly. The user interface is pretty simple yet comprehensive. You can even check the percentage of charge on the unit. The computer interface doesn't have an eject function so you do have to be careful not to remove it when your actually tranferring files.
customer_reviews.author: J. Esteban

customer_reviews.title: Mighty Mini
customer_reviews.text: It's amazing how much this little gem does and how inexpensive it was. I eliminated the clutter of CDs in my car by connecting my Clip + tomy stereo via a cassette adapter. The sound is awesome, the Clip plus providing plenty of signal for the car system to use. Battery life seems fine and charges are fast. Iplan to add a big micro sdhc card soon, but the 2Gb holds plenty as it is. The included earphones are fine. I just copy and paste my MP3s via Windows and the Clip + organizes them by artist>album>song title. I'm no music expert but I sure like this player.
customer_reviews.author: LE~Heureux

customer_reviews.title: Really great
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about this product is the open formats it supports. This includes not only files like ogg, flac, and mp3 files but also the fact that it uses a standard mini-usb port for both charging and file transfer and also a mini SD card to expand the memory. That means you can charge it with many standard mobile phone chargers. The gui is good too allowing you to navigate by folder OR by artist. This is really good if you organize your files by folder. Also, it has a RADIO. Battery life appears a bit short, meaning that you may not be able to leave it on all day.
customer_reviews.author: slartibartfast

customer_reviews.title: Yep, the cheap high end player.
customer_reviews.text: Yes the menu is horrible, but this thing is tiny and sounds amazing. If people are still buying mp3 player, this one is great... though to be honest most people like myself by it for the option to play uncompressed music at a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: An Amazing Player
customer_reviews.text: I am not exactly a high tech person, growing up with tube and transistor gear but at 66 years old, I can still appreciate what technology has brought. This tiny mp3 player is easy to navigate once I figured out that you must first remove the mylar covering over the screen. (my bad) This is really nice. I can upload all the music or more to the point, old radio programs to listen to while sitting at an air terminal for 11 hours because the airline screwed up. This kind of replaces my Panasonic SV-mp020 which requires an AA battery.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Osterholm

customer_reviews.title: Great little mp3 player
customer_reviews.text: I love this little thing. It's so easy to use, and I'm someone who finds iPods confusing. I didn't bother with the software cd, I just plug it into a computer (works fine with Win XP, 7, and Ubuntu Linux) and drag and drop my music into it. I like that I can expand it with larger sdhc cards. The only potential cons are that it doesn't look very durable, though I haven't had it very long and haven't tested that, and it's so small I worry it will get lost. It looks a lot bigger in the pictures, but in real life it's about twice the size of a iPod shuffle.
customer_reviews.author: Elley

customer_reviews.title: Okay started off well, then "Goodbye",stuck, won't work, junk
customer_reviews.text: No matter how we've tried, we cannot get this to work any more. either it's the "Goodbye" screen or, 20 seconds puching the off button, it comes back on, locks onto a "song" that doesnt exist and wont respond to anything. Tried to clear ALL music from the file via computer link - did so. Powered it up, same ficticious song was listed (nt) and it was jammed. It is junk - well, at this price what did we expect? The accessories you have to buy are, like old cell phone chargers, now useless.
customer_reviews.author: CarNut

customer_reviews.title: good cheap mp3 player
customer_reviews.text: I owned the previous version of the sansa clip, and when it finally gave up the ghost after a couple of years on the job, I bought this version. I'm as happy with this version as I was of the other. Great little (tiny) player with a built in FM radio, graphic equalizer, voice recorder, micro SD slot, etc.. The only negative is the earphones, personal preference I guess, but I couldn't use the ones that came with this player, they kept falling out of my ears, so I bought a pair of the squishy type that fit into my ear canal and stay put.
customer_reviews.author: anon by choice

customer_reviews.title: Best mp3 player I owned
customer_reviews.text: Lasted me years until I dropped it into water. Then it lasted a few more months before it completely died. But this is so organized, and you can put audiobooks in a folder on your sd card and access it in the audiobooks tab and it will play in order! I like that I can put my music into folders from my computer and access those folders on here. The folders and the audiobook functions are my favorite things about this.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for in this device. I have owned two of them and neither lasted over a year. They were used daily. They were very good for a cheap MP3 player in the short time they lasted. I listened to audiobooks and MP3s. The first one the volume button broke and would no longer work. I was able to extend its life but putting different software on it that allowed me to control the volume still. Both ended up no longer turning on after a while. I tried charging them in computers, outlets, etc., nothing would work.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this mp3 player --- It holds my songs -- I go walking everyday and it is perfect companion -- sound is crisp -- songs very easy to load -- doesn't require 12 year old to help his mom -- very easy to work -- I would advise to get - it is perfectly priced -- I can't do 1000 songs but if I did there is a port for more music - I have owned many types of mp3 players and I had one that lasted for years and I was so upset because they quit making it -- I am very pleased with this replacement --
customer_reviews.author: Julie Holy

customer_reviews.title: Best MP3 player I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: The best MP3 player you will find. Expandable storage, FM tuner. Perfect for working out. I have purchase one of these for everyone in my family and they all love them. If you can get ahold of this version, go for it, it's the best!
customer_reviews.author: Ian J.

customer_reviews.title: Great little MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: Great little MP3 player. Throw in a 32gb card and you've got a cheaper and arguably better alternative than an iPod. UI isnt as great as an iOS or android based player but it gets the job done. Supports almost all file types you'd need, if you plan on using FLAC, you'll need a high quality headset and amp to get the best sound quality as this thing doesn't put out much power.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great Investment for a Basic Player
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of buying a cheap Coby MP620 player. The thing wouldn't even turn on when I first tried it, and when it finally did turn on, it'd short if I moved it! Someone recommended the Sansa Clip to me and I purchased the 2GB a few months back. In short, I'm SUPER satisfied. I only needed something to hold the music I liked for my workouts, but this thing has enough space for audiobooks and more. Great battery life and not costly. I'm really glad I took the advice.
customer_reviews.author: HutchK44

customer_reviews.title: Best MP3 player for podcasts
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy everything about this little MP3 player. I have owned iPods, and other MP3 players in the past (Samsung YP-Z5, Samsung YP-K3, etc.). The area that this player really stands out in is podcasts (and probably audio books too). This player always remembers your position in a podcast, and lets you resume from where you left off if you leave the podcast. This is true even after syncing the MP3 player with a computer (the iPod fails in this regard). If you listen to lots of podcasts, Sansa is definitely the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: C. Matheson

customer_reviews.title: Good MP3 Player but Horrible for Audiobooks
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as the previous version. Horrible for audiobooks with long tracks. Fast forward sucks compared to the old one. Even the lock button doesn't lock everything, you can still accidently turn it off or change the volume. It also has a worse track memory and loses my place often. Don't buy this for audiobooks.
customer_reviews.author: B. Nash

customer_reviews.title: Not At All Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device to wear on my wrist while I run. The size is ideal. The appearance and quality seemed, at first, to be fine. However, this product has been an absolute disappointment. The volume is not loud enough to hear the music over surrounding ambient noise. Worst of all, when I turn the device off, the battery continues to drain. When I turn the device on, after leaving it off overnight, the battery will be dead. I cannot recommend this product. It completely failed to meet my expectations and I am utterly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Philibert

customer_reviews.title: Still works years later
customer_reviews.text: My family and I have used two of these older Sansa Clip+ units, and they have been working for many years. The features are not great but they meet the needs of a portable unit. The best part.... they keep working! They have out lasted 3 of the newer units (with the color screen)as well as several Zunes. I am glad that I can still order this older unit, and am buying another today.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Sr

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is my first mp3 player, and I love it! I bought to use when I work out, but I now enjoy listening to my podcasts when I drive or do chores as well! I use Itunes to manage my subscriptions, and Windows Media Player to sync. I rate the earbuds that came with the player as an 8.5 for sound and 6.5 for comfort. The battery life is stated as 15 hours, I have not really put that to the test yet. Clip is not removable but to me that's a plus. I think this is a great value for the money if video capability is not important to you.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a late adopter. There, I admit it. This was my first MP3 player. With inside (winter) training for a marathon on the dreadmill becoming unbearable; Sansa Clip Plus to the rescue! Super easy to use - instructions are not necessary. The battery life is better than the touted 15 hours. It has stood up to about 100 miles of my sweating without shorting out. The screen and price make the decision between a Shuffle and the Sansa Clip a no-brainer. If there is any knock against the Sansa Clip Plus, it's that the earbuds are marginal (as anyone would expect) and the claimed 2 GB memory is actually a rounded up number from the true memory of 1.8 GB.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: MY FAVORITE!
customer_reviews.text: I HAD TO GET A NEW ONE AFTER MY OLD ONE FELL IN A CUP OF COFFEE. I TRIED THE CLIP ZIP BUT NOT HAPPY WITH THE SEPARATE FILES FOR SDHC CARD AND THE INTERNAL MEMORY. SO, EVEN THOUGH THIS IS NOW TWICE AS MUCH AS ORIGINALLY COST I HAD TO HAVE IT. NO PROBLEM WITH REGISTRATION AT SANSA SITE. A 16 GB SDHC CARD &THE 2GB PLAYER IS JUST FINE.
customer_reviews.author: BigFan In MO.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: This little radio/mp3 does what it says it will do. I purchased it for the gym to listen to the TV w and mp3 player. My biggest issue is that it only goes to "regular" radio frequencies. My gym uses even frequencies and there in lies the problem: I can listen to 90.1 but not 90.8. My gym shows only three different channels so the frequency issue limits my options. Had I known this in advance I may have chose to purchase a different item. Either way, it is MUCH less expensive than a Nano and who doesn't appreciate that :)
customer_reviews.author: Joellen Corr

customer_reviews.title: An okay MP3 Player
customer_reviews.text: I do like this little MP3 player for the purpose that I purchased it. I don't have tons of music loaded on it, but I didn't intend to in the first place. I've never had any problems with it. The only thing I wish is that it would hold a charge a little longer. I can get about 5 hours of playing time with it before it has to recharge. For my purposes, 8 hours would be better. For the price though, it's good.
customer_reviews.author: S Kilson

customer_reviews.title: Our third Sansa player!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about Sandisk Sansa MP3 players? Reliable, long-lasting battery, small, expandible memory, They can play almost any kind of file (from MP3 to FLAC). I'm using a Sansa Clip+ 4GB as my daily mp3 player since 2012 and the only problem so far is the battery life (it is dying). This Sansa is going to be a backup mp3 player for my father (with a 16GB microsd card).
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Ponte

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk Sansa clip+
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use primarily in my car and to discontinue sirus radio. The Sansa was a bit hard to understand the downloading of music from my PC and to understand the menu on the small screen is impossible. I finally figured out the procedure for syncing with my PC after reading the Users Manual online and did manage to load my music. I'm not a novice with computers and thought this was a waist of money even at $34. I'm now shopping for an iPod touch which will work great in my auto.
customer_reviews.author: Duane A. Lueders

customer_reviews.title: One major failing
customer_reviews.text: This unit is small, inexpensive, has a great sound, incorporates a handy clip, and is easy to use. However, the battery life is about half of what is stated (7-8 hours instead of 15) and this puts a damper on the entire experience for me. And more than this, I resent the fact that the battery cannot be replaced. I have owned 6 of these as I use them for research that I am doing and I will continue to buy this product - but with less enthusiasm than I once had.
customer_reviews.author: george spelvin

customer_reviews.title: A basic mp3 player that works as promised
customer_reviews.text: This technology should be cheap by now, and this one was. I don't need huge memory or video or really anything fancy. Mostly just a player that I can move from the car to the gym. The gym and running is the key feature to my purchase. I've had arm bands in the past and had been comfortable with that, but the clip made me unsure of this one. However, its very small and light, and the clip has held up a couple weeks now and seems well made to me. So far it plays the mp3 in my car and in the gym, and suits my needs just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk Sansa Clip + 2 GB MP3 Player
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine introductory level MP3 player. I'm embarrassed to say that I had a problem with not removing the screen protector, it is quite thick and completely blocks out the screen when it's on. I was afraid of damaging the screen when I tried to remove it. After that debacle, it performed pretty well. I have discovered, when playing back a podcast, you can only skip to the next podcast, you can't fast forward/backward through it. I suspect it does the same with music.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Why buy an iPod?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with a 32GB SD card. It holds my entire music collection plus audio books with room to spare. It does everything i need it to do, battery lasts plenty long, recharges very fast, and costs <$30. It also supports Ogg Vorbis natively, doesn't require external software, and can be treated like a regular USB stick (which also makes it Linux friendly). You can put RockBox on it if those are not enough features for you. I can't imagine why anyone would buy an iPod these days just to listen to music when you can get something like this. The only thing lacking would be separate configurable playlists, but no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: lev

customer_reviews.title: just stopped working for no reason but company sent a replacement
customer_reviews.text: I was very unhappy at first when it just stopped working. After contacting the company a few times on the phone and talking with a representive, I ended up getting a replacement and provided with a prepaid postage sticker. The replacement MP3 player is working very well. It will occassionally freeze but you just press the on and off switch and hold for about 60 seconds and it will reboot. This may have been the problem with the first one or it may have been just a fluke... I've re-reviewed this product and upgraded it from one to five. I'm pretty happy with it now.
customer_reviews.author: rik

customer_reviews.title: D'OH!!!
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this player but make sure you remove the sticker from the screen or you may think your Clip is not charging and you may have to make an embarrassing call to tech support. "Sir, please remove the sticker from the screen." "Oh... I see. Uh... it's working after all." I got $20 worth of free music when I bought this. Since it was mp3s I'd been planning to buy, this player was only $11! (No, they didn't sucker me into an unwanted subscription. I took the free music and ran.)
customer_reviews.author: Holy Moly

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I know very little about Ipods and mp3 players, but I have totally enjoyed this player so far. I have figured out how to download music, which I had never done before, quite easily with a little help from my son. Although if you want to download from itunes, it would be easier of course with an ipod, this may be the only downfall. My son helped me initially with the downloads from itunes and just got me going now it is no problem for me. The sound that comes from this little unit is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: grama

customer_reviews.title: It came out better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: It came out better than I expected, very easy to use. just drag and paste as far as it concerns moving music. The sound quality is very good, and very durable. The memory size is just enough. And the size of the player is perfect, although I wouldn't mind a slightly bigger size of the same player. Good catch.
customer_reviews.author: Stephy

customer_reviews.title: Great for Audio Books
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace an old sansa USB clip that had died... I have a different player I use for music but I like to have a dedicated small player just for audio books. So far, this has exceeded my expectations -- very easy to just drag and drop MP3 files over to it -- it even has a default "audio books" directory so if i ever choose to load up some songs, they won't be mixed up with audio book tracks when i listen on shuffle. (note: i haven't tested this yet -- but it appears they are well segregated on the player). basically, for a relatively low price, i have an easy solution to meet my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Mim Z.

customer_reviews.title: Great MP3 player!
customer_reviews.text: My son had two Ipod Touches that he dropped and broke, so he jsut wanted a simple Mp3 player. After searching forever on the Internet I decided on this one. What a little gem I found! My son loves it. He has downloaded several songs, plays it forever before it needs to be charged, and loves the digital display that shows his song titles. It is simple to use, and was very affordable. I am so glad I found this because my son was costing me too much money with the fragile Ipods.
customer_reviews.author: M. Harless

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with this Product!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for a friend who does not have a computer. I wanted something that was low cost but that I could load up with training material for him to study. This device fit the bill perfectly. It is low cost, small, excellent battery life, and is easy to organize and load material onto. I have become so frustrated with itunes/iphone, I am thinking about getting a unit like this for myself and breaking free of Apple for my music and downloads.
customer_reviews.author: PJM

customer_reviews.title: Functions great, battery leaves much to be desired
customer_reviews.text: I bought this player to replace an outdated player for reliability during endurance events. This player functions very well and is easy to use. The battery life is stated as up to 15 hours, an average use will last 10 hours. The worst part is that the battery indicator is nowhere near accurate. I could handle a decreased battery life if I had a better gauge to know when to charge it. This unit will go from 1/2 or 1/3 battery power to dead in moments. It operates great though, so just remember to charge it too often.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Sunn

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product just for its FM. 1. Ease of use: Although the build quality leaves a lot to be desired, it is very easy to use. 2. Sound Quality: The quality is OK at low volume but I could feel a lot of distortion when I increased the volume. Also the FM receiver doesn't seem to be of good quality. Even in open spaces mobility causes distortion in the reception. earplugs look cheap so I will try changing them and hopefully it should make some difference.
customer_reviews.author: N. Pathak

customer_reviews.title: Some quality issues
customer_reviews.text: It does not include wall charger. I bought a Motorola Razr V3 charger from ebay for $0.99 that works well. If you charge through the USB port (usb cable is included), everytime you disconnect from the computer, it will take few mins/secs to refresh the media. Though I never used the player for outdoor activity gym etc, and handled it carefully, the headphone jack at the player became faulty after 4 months. However, Sandisk replaced the player immediately.
customer_reviews.author: chnn

customer_reviews.title: Sansa Clip+ player excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: Even though I work in a very high-tech job, generally I use high-tech products sparingly in personal life. Took me the longest time to get an MP3 player, home laptop or smart phone (kids have all 3) or a GPS (wife does). So wanted to buy an MP3 player with good recording capability for a child who is getting voice lessons (Indian classical music) -- very very easy to use (yes, an 8-year old can use it:-), transfer files to laptop, replay music. Probably a host of features I'm not using, but for what I needed, it was perfect. [Troglodyte at large]
customer_reviews.author: Bharat

customer_reviews.title: Great, small MP3 player/radio
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an MP3 player that I could use at the gym and for running. I wanted it to be small and have a clip so I could attach it to my shorts. This MP3 player has both. I like the fact that it has a microSD slot that I can use to increase the memory. This feature and the low price make it a great alternative to an Apple product. The software navigation is a bit counter-intuitive, and it took a while to figure out how to get a playlist installed, though. Other than these small annoyances, the MP3 player is great.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Love this little gizmo!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little mp3 player. It does everything your need plus more! I'm able to clip it anywhere, plug it into aux jack in my car, or just listen to radio around the house; the radio feature is quite handy and the microphone recording feature works great! This little gizmo is also sturdy can withstand falls & drops with no problems. Its much better than an ipod... Seriously it has expandable memory and its super cheap - I simply love it!
customer_reviews.author: N. R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Hot Sansa Clip
customer_reviews.text: Hot little mp3 player! Super easy to use. This is a super sleek, extremely portable (significantly smaller than a matchbook) device with a rechargeable battery. Sturdy innovative clip so you won't lose track of the unit or get headphones tangled. The sound quality is way better than any of the several other sansa mp3 players I own. This unit comes with a headphone set that outputs really rich, mellow, but crisp sound. Snap one up at this very competitive price. It's a steal!
customer_reviews.author: Larry G. Wachsmuth

customer_reviews.title: The definitive MP3 player.
customer_reviews.text: I like to listen music, watch videos nothing, just listen. This player is simple, easy to use, with intuitive software, which not even need to read the manual. I've had Sony Walkman, and I do not like dedicated software. You have to be turning their songs, wasting time and even when struggling with the software crash. With the Clip + is a simple drag and drop, nothing easier, nothing simpler.
customer_reviews.author: fabian poiso

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mini mp3 player
customer_reviews.text: So I had originally had a ipod shuffle the small 1gb one. All it did was to play music without a screen. Now this mp3 is a whole different breed of mini mp3 player. Tiny screen with surprisingly clear resolution , voice record , radio , uses a standard usb port , space for a media card?!?!?!. All of this fitted into a cool black cased blue screen design. Very easy to use and the space is sufficient. It is even easier to transfer music onto than the garbage itunes library method . So ANYONE looking for a cheap yet high quality mp3 this is strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D. BASIR

customer_reviews.title: Best mp3 player I've owned lately
customer_reviews.text: I had a Zen Stone I thought was broken so I bought this to replace it and I like it better, despite the bulkier size. I like that I can delete music directly off the player instead of having to plug it back in to the computer to do so. The only thing I don't like is the location of the volume adjustment. It's awkward to reach quickly and use. Other than that, a good little mp3 player.
customer_reviews.author: may

customer_reviews.title: Close to Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Best little mp3 i ever owned. Simple, functional, music storage with pc is a snap, radio has great reception and charge life is amazing. Should have bought more to give to friends, a really good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Great for the Road/Workout/Commute
customer_reviews.text: I am not a big person for electronics but decided I needed a Mp3 player to keep me occupied now that I commute around town on the subway and train.Sansa is a small MP3 player,literally it is as big as long as my pinky finger.You don't have to know a lot about technology to use it.You plug it into your computer and drag the files to the Sansa Clip file and as easy as ABC you'll have music and audio books.I LOVE the clip on it,that allows you to clip it anywhere while you're on the go.Also in terms of sound,it is can really go loud for a player this small.I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Sexy Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Nice little player
customer_reviews.text: The Sansa Clip series are rated the best I've seen so far. I need to record off fm all day, unfortunately, it only records in .wav format, so 2gb wasn't enough. So I had to take off a star. But it's pretty easy to navigate, very light, it clips on and has a long battery life. So overall I'm pleased, I just had to return it for a higher capacity, because there is no option to record to the micro SD card.
customer_reviews.author: jblilbear

customer_reviews.title: Ultra portable and easily worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for about a month now. Ultra portable and EASILY worth every penny. I wish the battery life was longer. It will easily last a day at work, but not two days...no problem as you can recharge at computer when not in use. I bought it more for going running or exercise, but haven't used it for that purpose yet. Radio reception while moving isn't the greatest, but I was using it inside a building. Might be fine outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K

customer_reviews.title: Great player for talk radio programs
customer_reviews.text: Player is great for talk radio programs, it allows you to move around within the segments and has good titling to inform you of your current location. Life expectancy is 2000-3000 hrs. When they fail, just buy a new one, customer service is not good and not worth attempting to contact. I have had 3 of these players and they get constant use. I add and delete programs constantly so 2 megs is enough for current storage of programs to be listened to in the next few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: David B Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, good design
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design so I kept buying more each time the Clip stopped working. After 4 that all lasted less than 6 months ... I give up. If they are to be throw away, I will buy cheaper throw away players. So far ... the battery flaked and wouldn't charge ... then the Clip wouldn't read the mini-SD and confused all the loaded files ... then the volume control button would only work in the minus direction (internal button fell off on inspection) ... a one had the display stop working. Enough.
customer_reviews.author: a different Victor

customer_reviews.title: Very good little player
customer_reviews.text: This is really a good little player. About the size and the weight of a small matchbox. The sound coming out of this thing is awesome. Perfect for workouts and runs. It has a clip in the back that attaches easily to a waistband or shirt sleeve. It's so lightweight, you forget it's there. Highly recommend. This is my second clip- only because the first one was accidentally run through the washing machine and dryer. My daughter has one too.
customer_reviews.author: G. Kimble

customer_reviews.title: The Disposable MP3 Player
customer_reviews.text: My Sansa Clip broke after 6 months. The volume "up" button stopped functioning, rendering my Sansa useless. A search on the web indicates many others have had the same problem. Great while it lasted; prior to this I had even recommended it to a coworker who bought one based on my high praise. I bought my daughter the Fuze just before my Clip broke. I hope she gets more life out of hers but if it does break within a year I guess I won't be surprised.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cornwell

customer_reviews.title: No frills, just right
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to replace one I wore out. I ran this one through the washer, and after about 2 weeks sitting in dried rice, works fine. No frills, just what I want. Also, radio works great
customer_reviews.author: ZeldaP

customer_reviews.title: Great sound.  Clip design is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I was very satisfied with this product when I received it. Great sound, extremely portable, and the expandable memory is an excellent feature. However, after only two days, I noticed that the clip was broken on one side. I was very disappointed, as this was one of the main reasons why I purchased this product. Overall, great mp3 player. It actually plays through my car's stereo system using the mini USB cord. Great additional feature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Should have paid attentio to the 1 star reviews
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an inexpensive mp3 player with a radio and this seemed to fit the bill. The instructions that came with it were pretty bad, which was my first clue. Anyway, I managed to get some songs loaded after charging the unit. It then worked for maybe 90 minutes and just died - wouldn't turn on, couldn't charge it - just dead. Fortunately Amazon has a decent return policy. Another lesson learned - pay attention to bad product reviews!
customer_reviews.author: Vinyl Spin

customer_reviews.title: what a shame about the battery
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like the Sansa clip. Great controls, SD card expansion, and easy to load music and books onto but why oh why does it have such a pitiful battery life. I have kept my Sansa clip as a back up but for serious on the go listening i have reverted to my creative Zen mozaic EZ 300. 28 hours listening, Wow! It's a shame that creative have superseded them with a different model. Go and buy one now while they are still available.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: still good
customer_reviews.text: bought a couple of these in late '09 and both are working fine with daily use. The charge doesn't hold as long as when new but that's to be expected. The only thing I wish this player had is a volume equalizer so I wouldn't have to fiddle with the volume when a song is too low or too loud. And if you plan to add a lot of mp3's go with the higher gb version, rather than using the micro cards---I've bought two and they are slow and unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: tc55

customer_reviews.title: Compact, dependable, just right.
customer_reviews.text: Just right for my needs, easy to use and transfer files to. It acts like just another USB drive when attached to the computer. It stalled a couple of times and I thought it was broken, but holding down the home button for 15 seconds or more (as the instructions say to do) rebooted the system and it worked just fine again. I've had it for several years now.
customer_reviews.author: S. Reid

customer_reviews.title: You won't bekieve your ears!
customer_reviews.text: This little MP3 player will not disappoint you. With the 2 GB of internal storage- and the ability to add up 8 or more GB with a MiniSD you are not going to run out of storage space. But most importantly, the music sounds great and the controls, which are easy to use, provide several playback options. I use "FreeRip" to covert my cd's to MP3 format to play on the Sansa Clip+. If you have decent computer speakers, you can plug them into the Sansa Clip+ headphone jack and have great music through the speakers. For the price, this is an incredible buy!
customer_reviews.author: PRESCOTT JIM

customer_reviews.title: Not like previous models.
customer_reviews.text: I can only rate this player as OK. IT'S smaller than its forerunner. Three of these would easily fit in a man's shirt pocket. There's no wheel anymore which really bothers me. Sound is good. Overall it's a acceptable player but I just want more to hold when it's in my hand and I like rolling to the setting I want. Not clicking to it. The wheel version was a lot smoother to operate.
customer_reviews.author: RON

customer_reviews.title: 3rd one I have bought
customer_reviews.text: 3rd one I have bought. Love these things. They last a long time and the "recording" feature has come in handy so many times. I think it is easy to use and you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: evergreenstreet

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: When this Sansa Clip+ breaks I will fix it or find another Sansa Clip+ as a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Finicus Fudge

customer_reviews.title: great mp3 player
customer_reviews.text: Hi - my wife and I bought this for my dad. He isn't very technical so we wanted to get something that was easy to use, small, and reliable. He's had it now for 1 year, uses it primary when he's outside doing yard work and he really likes it. For the price, this is a great product. It doesn't have any big bells and whistles. It is durable. I hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo A. Campos

customer_reviews.title: Washed it and it still works....
customer_reviews.text: Different kind of review, i accidentally "washing-machine" tested the mp3 player. Initially, it did not work after being washed and through the dryer. I gave it a day, tried it again, and it worked normally. This $30.00 mp3 player works fine, but apparantly can also take some abuse and still work great. For those folks that just need an mp3 player for music, this is an excellent, inexpensive choice.
customer_reviews.author: G. Pliler

customer_reviews.title: I have always liked SanDisk...
customer_reviews.text: I used this just yesterday. I had a Coby unit that this replaced. The Coby could display photos, and had built-in speakers, but the Sansa Clip is smaller and has a clip that works - didn't know what I was missing. The supplied ear buds produce decent sound and are comfortable to wear. I have always liked SanDisk.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Lang

customer_reviews.title: Good for working out
customer_reviews.text: This is a good alternative for listening to music while working out compared to an iPhone or Android phone (if using wired headphones.) It is so light and small it is barely noticeable while lifting. The clip is especially great when working out with pants without pockets. I prefer listening to music from my phone any other time so I do not have to carry around multiple devices. I suggest this to anybody who think their phone is too bulky and annoying while working out.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little device
customer_reviews.text: This beats an ipod shuffle any day!! It WILL sync w/podcasts (it acts as a hard drive), has FM radio, u can delete podcasts right off the player itself w/o going through computer, can expand w/up to 16 GB microSD card. The player is so small it's crazy!! Plus has a decent display to scroll through your music. Also has voice recorder. Can even record FM radio - cool! battery life is great too. Only complaint is erratic radio volume (in and out) depending on reception - not a dealbreaker by any means.
customer_reviews.author: Cousin Vinny

customer_reviews.title: Decent mp3 player
customer_reviews.text: It was 2004 when the last time I bought Sansa MP3 player. Sansa is on the market for a long time and usually produces quality products. After using it more than a month here is my evaluation: Pros: -Easy to use -Has expansion slot -Great sound quality -Tiny Cons: -Battery life may be up to 10 hours but I have never seen 15 hours of battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Andy K

customer_reviews.title: SanDisk Sansa Clip MP3 player
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 7 year old daughter for her birthday. She loves it. I preloaded it with some music before I gave it to her. It was easy to put music on it, easy to find music, it has radio stations, it has a voice recorder. This little MP3 player has it all. The headphones aren't the best, but not bad. After giving it to her for her birthday, I think I want one for myself. Maybe for my birthday...hint hint.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Lombardo

product_meta.title: SanDisk Sansa Clip+ 2 GB MP3 Player (Black)
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe Sansa Clip and MP3 player gives you more to enjoy. Enjoy up to 2,000 songs with an 8 GB player, FM radio, long-life battery and voice recorder. PLUS now even more, Expand your enjoyment when you add in preloaded content cards into the new memory card slot, including slotRadioTM cards. Or, save your own music, podcasts, and audiobooks onto a microSDTM or microSDHCTM memory card to expand your play.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
There's so much more to love when you play with a SanDisk Sansa Clip+ MP3 player. With two gigabytes of storage, this tiny player lets you listen to up to 500 songs in stunning audio quality. It boasts a wide array of outstanding features, including an FM radio, long-life battery, and integrated voice recorder. And with its expandable memory card slot, you can add pre-loaded microSD, slotRadio or slotMusic cards, so you can listen to your favorite music, podcasts and audio books without having to access a computer or wait for downloads. 

 

Tiny MP3 Player with Big Sound
Brought to you by SanDisk, the global leader in flash memory cards, the Sansa Clip+ MP3 player offers distinctively big sound and a wide array of features packed into a tiny, ultra-compact design. The Sansa Clip+ MP3 player, recipient of an August 2009 CNET Editors' Choice award, is built to bring your music to life. The player features solid-state flash memory for skip-free playback, making it ideal for working out with, and with MP3 quality for a rich, full-bodied sound. Whether you're a jazz aficionado or a classic rocker, the Sansa Clip+ MP3 player will ensure that your music comes through loudly and clearly. 

 The Sansa Clip+ MP3 player supports the most popular audio formats, including MP3, WMA, secure WMA, Audible, Ogg Vorbis, and FLAC. 

 Expandable Memory Slot for slotMusic and slotRadio Cards
Thanks to the Sansa Clip+ MP3 player's expandable memory card slot, you don't have to rely on your computer or the Internet to listen to the music you love. Simply insert a preloaded microSD or microSDHC card, and you'll be ready to play music, podcasts, or audio books in seconds--with no waiting for downloads and no computer required. 

 You can also use the memory slot to add slotMusic or slotRadio cards for even more music options. slotMusic and slotRadio cards let you instantly enjoy your favorite music without being dependent on a computer or Internet access.

 slotMusic cards include a full album of your favorite artist and have plenty more room to add music from your own music library. Simply choose your favorite artist and slotMusic cards will give it to you straight from the package to your eardrums. 

 And with select slotRadio cards, you'll get 1,000 songs‡ preloaded onto a card. Each card features handcrafted playlists and hundreds of artists from top music charts. Whether you want Rock, Hip-hop, Country -- there's a slotRadio card that will get you movin' and groovin'. 

 (Note: microSD, microSDHC, slotMusic, and slotRadio cards are sold separately. Visit sandisk.com for details about slotMusic and slotRadio cards.) 

 

Just Clip and Go
Everything about the Sansa Clip+ MP3 player is designed with your active lifestyle in mind. About the size of a matchbox, it weighs less than an ounce and features an integrated clip that secures firmly to your clothing for easy, hands-free portability, making it the ideal MP3 player to take on your morning runs or afternoon workouts.  A large, bright, easy-to-read OLED screen and searchable menus make it easy to choose playlists or songs, while the long-life rechargeable battery offers up to 15 hours† of continuous playback. 

 In addition to all the great digital music features, the Sansa Clip+ MP3 player includes an integrated digital FM tuner with 40 presets for listening to sports, talk radio, or your favorite music stations at the gym.
